business.headline: Stocks to watch: Eternal, Tata Motors, Adani Enterprises, Infosys, MahindraBoth the Sensex and Nifty ended slightly lower in the last session, as cautious sentiment prevailed among investors over rising India-Pakistan tension.

Air India expects $600 million in losses if Pak airspace shut for a year: ReportThe closure of Pakistani airspace for a year would result in losses of USD 600 million for the country's national carrier, Air India, news agency PTI reported, citing sources. The airline has sought the government's assistance to address the challenges.

RBI makes PRAVAAH portal mandatory for financial institutions starting May 1The PRAVAAH portal provides all necessary forms, along with simple instructions. Users can submit their application, track its progress, and even get alerts.
GST collections hit record Rs 2.37 lakh crore in April, up 12.6%In March, GST collections stood at Rs 1.96 lakh crore, showing a 9.9% rise from the same period last year.

Nithin Kamath exposes this scam using his name to dupe investors. Details hereZerodha's CEO Nithin Kamath has urged investors to stay alert, always check the source, and never act on random financial advice sent on messaging apps.

Adani Ports Q4 results: Net profit soars 50%, revenue up 23%The company reported a 50% rise in its consolidated net profit, which stood at Rs 3,023 crore. This is an increase from Rs 2,025 crore reported in the same quarter last year.

From ATM charges to LPG prices: 5 key financial changes to know in May 2025Starting May 1, taking cash out from an ATM after your free monthly limit will cost you Rs 23 per transaction, up from the current Rs 21.
Zomato Q4 earnings: What to expect from Eternal's January-March resultsAnalysts expect mixed numbers for the fourth quarter, mainly due to expected higher losses from its quick commerce arm, Blinkit.

'Gold doesn't always glitter': This CA's post might change your mindA CA pointed out a combination of global shocks, like COVID-19, wars, inflation fears, and central bank purchases, which all contributed to the price spike in the yellow metal since 2020.

'Deliberately false': Elon Musk slams report claiming Tesla looking to replace himElon Musk responded furiously on X, calling it "an EXTREMELY BAD BREACH OF ETHICS" and slamming the WSJ for "publishing a DELIBERATELY FALSE ARTICLE" despite receiving a prior denial from Tesla's board.

Vedanta Q4 profit more than doubles: Check price target, FY26 estimates and moreWith expansion projects nearing completion and deleveraging underway, analysts believe Vedanta is positioning itself for a stronger, leaner phase of growth.

New ITR Forms 1 and 4 notified for FY 2024-2025. Check key changes, who can fileITR-1, or Sahaj, is for resident individuals who have an overall income of not more than Rs 50 lakh a year and the income is from a salary or pension, single house property, or income like interest from bank deposits or fixed deposits.

entertainment.headline: British comedian Russell Brand to appear in London court today on rape chargesBritish actor-comedian Russell Brand will appear in a London court after being charged with rape and sexual assault in cases related to four women over two decades ago.

Mira Rajput lends helping hand to Deepika Padukone in adorable viral videoShahid Kapoor's wife Mira Rajput helped Deepika Padukone fix her dress at the WAVES summit 2025, held on Thursday in Mumbai. The viral video of the two from the event has emerged on social media.

Selena Gomez Reflects on Justin Bieber breakup and finding love with Benny BlancoSelena Gomez reflects on her journey of heartbreak following her breakup with Justin Bieber. Now engaged to Benny Blanco, she says she has found emotional peace, joy, and lasting love.

Jeremy Renner slams Disney over pay cut for Hawkeye Season 2 Jeremy Renner claims Disney offered him half the pay for Hawkeye Season 2 following his near-fatal accident, calling the offer insulting. Disney sources disputed his version but offered no details.

All about Met Gala 2025: Theme, dress code, and star co-chairsThe 2025 Met Gala returns May 5 with the theme "Superfine: Tailoring Black Style," honoring Black fashion. Co-chaired by celebrities, it celebrates heritage, history, and bold menswear creativity.

Diddy rejects plea deal, faces life sentence in federal sex trafficking trialSean "Diddy" Combs has rejected a federal plea deal and will face trial next week on sex trafficking and racketeering charges. He denies all allegations and pleads not guilty.

One Piece animator wants sound team of anime to be 'immediately fired'One Piece animator Sota Shigetsugu has sparked controversy by criticising the sound team for their 'unprofessional' work in the latest episode of the anime. The criticism comes after the release of Episode 1127, where the sound effects were deemed outdated and poorly executed.

Tourist Family review: Sasikumar-Simran film is all white and pure loveReleased-Thu May 01, 2025Tourist Family review: Director Abishan Jeevinth's 'Tourist Family' starring Sasikumar, Simran, Mithun Jai Shankar and Kamalesh, is a beautiful drama about humanity. It's also a brilliant example of what simple films can evoke in you.

Ajith Kumar reflects on life and retirement after Padma Bhushan honourTamil star Ajith Kumar, who recently received the Padma Bhushan, shared insights on his approach to life and retirement, emphasising the value of making the most of every moment.

Shah Rukh Khan weighs in on insider vs outsider debate: I have a problemShah Rukh Khan recently weighed in on the insider vs outsider debate at the WAVES Summit 2025. The actor mentioned how he has a problem with the distinction.

K-pop star Jackson Wang teams up with Diljit Dosanjh for new singleInternational pop star Jackson Wang and Indian music icon Diljit Dosanjh have joined forces for a new single. Titled 'BUCK', it is set to release on May 9.

Virat Kohli's birthday wish for his 'best half' Anushka Sharma is all things loveCricketer Virat Kohli wished his actor-wife Anushka Sharma with an adorable post on social media. He shared a beautiful picture of the couple on the special day.

Sonu Nigam brings up 'Pahalgam' during concert, feels 'threatened' by Kannada fanSinger Sonu Nigam was performing in Bengaluru when a fan started screaming, demanding a Kannada song. The singer paused the concert, addressed the incident, and also mentioned the ghastly Pahalgam terror attack.

HIT 3 review: Nani's film has its moments, but it's more a miss than a hitReleased-Thu May 01, 2025'HIT: The Third Case' is the third instalment from the successful HIT universe created by director Sailesh Kolanu. The film stars Telugu actor Nani and Srinidhi Shetty of KGF fame in the lead. The third part of the franchise has scaled up considerably and attempts to gain more mass appeal, but does it work?

Salman Khan in talks to play Army Officer in film on 2020 Galwan Valley clash?Bollywood superstar Salman Khan is in talks to star as an Indian Army officer in a war drama about the 2020 Galwan Valley clash. The film will be based on the book, India's Most Fearless 3, and will be directed by Apoorva Lakhia.

Retro review: Suriya's overstuffed film stumbles between eras and ideasReleased-Thu May 01, 2025Retro movie review: Director Karthik Subbaraj's 'Retro', starring Suriya, Joju George and Pooja Hegde, is an overstuffed love story with a gangster backdrop. While the film begins on a spectacular note, it fizzles as it progresses.
Singer Shaan, Rakhi Gulzar's emotional interaction at event. WatchSinger Shaan recently got emotional after he met veteran actor Rakhi Gulzar. A video from their heartfelt interaction has gone viral.

HIT 3 X review: Audience calls Nani's film sensational and stylish, see postsHIT 3 X movie review: Nani's action entertainer has made the audience go bonkers on social media. Several viewers like the actor's style, and the ruthless cop avatar in the third film from the franchise.

Shanaya Kapoor's Ankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan to be monsoon entertainer, release date outShanaya Kapoor is all set to make her Bollywood debut alongside Vikrant Massey in the romantic film, 'Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan', releasing on July 11th, 2025. The motion poster was released earlier this year.

general news.headline: 4 of family dead after roof of house collapses due to strong winds in DelhiDelhi-NCR was hit by heavy rainfall coupled with severe thunderstorms and gusty winds early on Friday. A red alert is in place in the national capital, with flights being delayed due to the inclement weather conditions.

India's response to Pahalgam terror attack should avoid regional war: JD VanceUnderlining that India's response to last week's Pahalgam attack should avoid the risk of a broader regional conflict, US Vice President JD Vance hoped that Pakistan would work with India to track down terrorists who carried out the attack.

Air India expects $600 million in losses if Pak airspace shut for a year: ReportThe closure of Pakistani airspace for a year would result in losses of USD 600 million for the country's national carrier, Air India, news agency PTI reported, citing sources. The airline has sought the government's assistance to address the challenges.

Rivers in Pakistan aren't drying yet. Here's whyOfficial data and satellite imagery processed by India Today's Open-Source Intelligence (OSINT) team suggest rivers allocated to Pakistan under the IWT – the Indus, Chenab, and Jhelum (collectively called Western rivers) – continued to flow their normal course and speed as of April 30.

BJP's caste census strike: Why did Modi government make a U-turn?The Bharatiya Janata Party-led Centre has announced it will conduct a caste census in a decision that has surprised the Opposition and political analysts.

Blood will flow in rivers: Hafiz Saeed's old speech targeting India after J&K attackOld incendiary speeches by Lashkar-e-Taiba chief Hafiz Saeed were played at rallies of the Pakistan Markazi Muslim League across Pakistan, more than a week after 26 people were killed in a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam.

US Defence Secretary dials Rajnath Singh, backs India's right to defend itselfUS Secretary of Defence Pete Hegseth reiterated Washington's full support for India's fight against terrorism during a conversation with Defence Minister Rajnath Singh.

MP flags OTT show showing sex positions days after Centre's 'perversity' remarkUllu App's show 'House Arrest' hosted by Ajaz Khan has sparked a controversy after contestants were seen mimicking sex positions. It has drawn political attention and fresh scrutiny of OTT content regulation.

Rohit Sharma out or not out vs RR? DRS decision sparks social media debateRohit Sharma's lbw review during Match 50 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) became a hot talking point on social media as a large section of fans were unhappy with the on-field decision being overturned.

Shashi Tharoor receives PM in Thiruvananthapuram, says managed to land in timeCongress MP Shashi Tharoor, a four-time lawmaker from Thiruvananthapuram, said he "managed to land in time" to receive Prime Minister Narendra Modi in the city and slammed the Delhi airport for flight delays.

Pak seals Wagah border, refuses to accept its own citizens cleared by IndiaStranded at their own doorstep, over a dozen Pakistanis waited at a shut Wagah gate, as Islamabad offered no explanation for refusing re-entry to their own citizens.

Trump's aide who leaked Signal chat loses key role, nominated to be UN envoyNational Security Advisor Mike Waltz, facing heat for accidentally adding a journalist to a Signal group chat on Yemeni airstrikes, has been nominated  by President Donald Trump for US's Ambassador to UN.

IPL 2025: Ruthless MI top table, knock Rajasthan Royals out of playoffs raceMumbai Indians (MI) continued their winning run in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) with a 100-run win over Rajasthan Royals (RR) at Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur. The victory extended their winning streak to six matches as they climbed to the top of the points table.

Pakistan violates border ceasefire for 8th straight night, Army respondsPakistani troops continued ceasefire violations along the Line of Control for the eighth consecutive night with unprovoked firing in Kupwara, Baramulla, Poonch, Naushera, and Akhnoor areas of Jammu and Kashmir.

Government fact-checks claims of Air Force officer's sacking over Pak war stanceThe government fact-checked claims by several pro-Pakistan social media accounts that said that Vice Chief of Air Staff Air Marshal Sujeet Pushpakar Dharkar was sacked for refusing to fight a war against Pakistan.

West Bengal Madhyamik Result 2025 Live: Websites to check WBBSE 10th Result, direct link WB Madhyamik Result 2025: The WBBSE 10th Result will be declared today at 9 am on the official websites and India Today.

CIA uses social media to lure Chinese spies, espionage tactics go viralThe CIA released videos in Chinese on social media asking disillusioned Chinese officials to share secrets. The clips depict fictional spies seeking freedom, as part of a wider US recruitment campaign.

Deportation of CRPF constable, 3 other 'Pak nationals' paused by J&K High CourtThe evidence produced in court dates back to 2014 land records, familial ties and government service records, which were taken on record by the court to halt the deportation of four family members who are alleged to be Pakistani nationals.

Caste census and reservation debate: What does the law say about 50% cap?Articles 15 and 16 of the Constitution allow the states to make special provisions for socially and educationally backward classes, as well as for Scheduled Castes (SCs) and Scheduled Tribes (STs), especially in education and public employment.

Trump threatens sanctions on nations buying Iranian oil: No business with US thenPresident Donald Trump warned that any country or individual buying Iranian oil or petrochemicals will face immediate secondary sanctions and be barred from doing business with the US.

Will Akhilesh-Ambedkar poster row mar SP's Dalit votes plan?The poster, conceded by Akhilesh Yadav as a mistake, has raked up controversy at a time his party is making visible attempts to woo the Dalit electorate

'100% fruit juice' claim by Dabur misleading, food regulator FSSAI tells courtThe food regulator's remarks came in response to Dabur's petition challenging the June 2024 notification, which requires food business operators to stop marketing reconstituted fruit juices as "100 per cent fruit juice".

Diddy rejects plea deal, faces life sentence in federal sex trafficking trialSean "Diddy" Combs has rejected a federal plea deal and will face trial next week on sex trafficking and racketeering charges. He denies all allegations and pleads not guilty.
Nepali student found dead in Bhubaneswar university hostel, 2nd case in 3 monthsPolice said the Nepali student was found hanging in her room around 7 pm in one of the girls' hostels.

sports.headline: Nasty-fasty Jasprit Bumrah peaking at the right time for MIJasprit Bumrah bowled a fiery spell against Rajasthan on Thursday, May 1, guiding his team to the top spot of the IPL points table. Bumrah bowled some nasty bouncers in the game, which rattled the Royals batters in Jaipur.

Europa League: Manchester United thrash 10-man Athletic Bilbao, Spurs down BodoA brace from Bruno Fernandes and a goal from Casemiro in the first half saw Manchester United thrash 10-man Athletic Bilbao in the first leg of the Europa League semi-final on Thursday, May 1.

Gill suffered back spasm during the team's previous match vs Rajasthan Royals.

Yamal was sensational in Barca's first leg of semi-final against Inter Milan.

Bangladesh should have won the series vs Zimbabwe: Najmul ShantoBangladesh skipper Najmul Hossain Shanto said that the Tigers should have won the Test series against Zimbabwe. Shanto's Tigers beat the visitors by an innings and 106 runs in Chattogram.

Barely slept the night before: Suryakumar recalls Mumbai Indians debutIPL 2025: Suryakumar Yadav recalled his IPL debut for the Mumbai Indians back in 2012 against Pune Warriors. The right-handed batter recently completed 4000 runs in the IPL.

Pickleball lands in administrative war as AIPA opposes government recognition of IPAThe All India Pickleball Association (AIPA) has opposed the Sports Ministry's decision to grant National Sports Federation (NSF) status to the Indian Pickleball Association (IPA), calling the move unjustified in a letter dated April 25, 2025.

Suyash thanks RCB for life-changing hernia surgery: I used to take injectionsIPL 2025: RCB leg-spinner Suyash Sharma said how the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) helped him recover from his hernia surgeries.

Punjab Kings star Glenn Maxwell ruled out of IPL 2025 due to finger fracturePunjab Kings' Australian all-rounder Glenn Maxwell was ruled out of the remainder of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 season due to a fractured finger.

I'm too stupid to answer that question: Iga Swiatek shuts down journalistFive-time Grand Slam champion Iga Swiatek found herself in an awkward position after a journalist asked her a question in the press conference after her Madrid Open quarterfinal against Madison Keys.

Yuzvendra Chahal explains his IPL hattrick heroics vs CSKAfter taking his second IPL hattrick, Yuzvendra Chahal revealed that he relied on his instincts and tweaked his line during their IPL clash against Chennai Super Kings.

Women's T20 World Cup 2026 in England to start on June 12The Women's T20 World Cup 2026 is scheduled to take place from June 12 to July 5. 33 matches will take place across 24 days in seven venues. Lord's will host the grand finale.

Mumbai Indians sign Raghu Sharma as replacement for injured Vignesh PuthurMumbai Indians spinner Vignesh Puthur was ruled out of the remainder of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 due to injury. The MI team management have signed Raghu Sharma as a replacement for the injured Vignesh Puthur.

RR vs MI: Can Rajasthan hamper Mumbai's winning momentum to stay alive?IPL 2025, RR vs MI: Mumbai Indians have a great chance of becoming the table-toppers, while Rajasthan Royals are looking for a win to stay alive in the competition.

Rohit Sharma reveals chat with his parents after Wankhede stadium honourIndia captain Rohit Sharma revealed that he has convinced his parents to come to the Wankhede stadium and watch his match from the stand named after him.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi has changed the momentum for RR, says Riyan ParagRajasthan Royals' interim captain Riyan Parag has lauded 14-year-old batting sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi for his maturity and impact on the squad.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
